methodology: Pre-extracted exposures from fact-registry.md SECTION 9, validated against financial-impact-analysis.md and research-review-report.md HIGH SEVERITY FINDINGS table

findings: GMWB + Captive Combined (T9+T2): $5.7M weighted (0.625% joint prob)
IUL Class Action Settlement (T4): $30M-$35M target, $8.3M net after E&O coverage
Global Re LOC Renewal (T5): $95.6M weighted (12.5% prob)
Investment Portfolio Stress (T8): $59.65M weighted (credit + mortgage + rate stress)
Agent Attrition Net (T10): $109.9M weighted (75% prob, after mitigation)

tax_structure.note: Capital injection is required investment, not a loss, but included for completeness
findings: Capital Injection via Surplus Notes (T11): $150M, 5.14% after-tax cost, NPV optimal structure

top_10_risks.mitigation: Surplus notes structure (100% TAC credit, 5.14% after-tax cost, Nebraska DOI approval 95% probability)
$20M retention bonus program (ROI 450%, reduces attrition from 25% to 10-15%)
$300M LOC backstop (reduces probability to 5-8%, annual cost $2.55M-$3.45M)
LOC renewal confirmation through 2030 or alternative reinsurer substitution
Excess of loss reinsurance $100M xs $50M (annual premium $2.0M-$2.8M)
Market-driven risk, limited controllability, duration gap -0.7 years
N/A - This is mitigation cost itself (ROI 450% net benefit $37.2M)
A+ rating, authorized reinsurer, minimal risk given rating stability
Portfolio diversification, 7% below-IG concentration (vs 4.8% industry avg)
CRE risk driven by WFH trend, office exposure $500M (35% of CML portfolio)

deal_blocking_scenarios.trigger: Nebraska DOI final examination report (Q1 2025) disallows $850M reserve credit
deal_blocking_scenarios.consequence: Nebraska DOI authorized to seize company; rating downgrade A- → BBB; transaction likely fails state approval
deal_blocking_scenarios.mitigation: $300M LOC backstop pre-closing (reduces probability to 5-8%), OR $150M purchase price reduction

deal_blocking_scenarios.trigger: Simultaneous: (1) Captive recapture 12.5% AND (2) GMWB 95th percentile stress 5%
deal_blocking_scenarios.consequence: RBC 101% triggers corrective action; no prudent acquirer closes with active regulatory intervention; conservatorship risk within 12-24 months
deal_blocking_scenarios.mitigation: Dual: (1) Captive LOC $300M + (2) GMWB reinsurance excess of loss $100M xs $50M

deal_blocking_scenarios.trigger: Simultaneous: (1) Captive recapture 12.5% AND (2) GMWB 99th percentile stress 1%
deal_blocking_scenarios.consequence: RBC <100% ACL requires Nebraska DOI seizure unless 90-day cure; deal unwinds; $2.9B transaction fails
deal_blocking_scenarios.mitigation: Same dual mitigation reduces probability to <0.1%
deal_blocking_scenarios.note: Even at <0.15% probability, severity is catastrophic; mitigation IMPERATIVE

base_case.status: Below 200% CAL, requires Nebraska DOI Plan, manageable
base_case.description: No captive recapture, median GMWB ($54M), mild rate rise, 20% agent attrition, litigation within reserves

bear_case.status: Above 150% RAL but materially below 200% CAL; requires enhanced Plan + potential supplemental capital
bear_case.description: No captive recapture, 75th GMWB ($90M), Global Re LOC fails, 30% agent attrition, IUL settlement exceeds reserve

severe_downside.status: BETWEEN ACL (70-100%) AND MCL (<70%); Nebraska DOI authorized to seize; DEAL-BLOCKING
severe_downside.description: Captive recaptures ($730M), 95th GMWB ($127M), severe investment stress, deep recession, 35% agent attrition

catastrophic.status: BELOW 70% MCL; MANDATORY CONTROL LEVEL; Nebraska DOI MUST seize unless 90-day cure
catastrophic.description: Captive recaptures, 99th GMWB ($243M), multiple reinsurer failures, black swan market event

captive_recapture.release_trigger: Nebraska DOI final exam report (Q1 2025) confirms no recapture required

agent_attrition.release_trigger: Actual attrition ≤25% at Month 24; release proportionally

global_re_reinsurance.release_trigger: Global Re LOC renewed through 2030; no counterparty defaults

litigation.release_trigger: IUL settles ≤$40M; no new class actions filed

release_schedule.month_18: 25% ($100M) if RBC >180% for 12 months + Global Re renewed

coverage_analysis.severe_case_coverage: 25% ($400M escrow / $1,614M severe exposure) - acceptable given 5% probability

escrow_analysis.largest_exposure_note: Captive recapture $730M exceeds escrow, but probability only 12.5%; partial coverage $150M allocated
adequacy_flags: Escrow covers 92% of base case (50th percentile) exposure
Escrow covers 52% of bear case (75th percentile) - within industry standard 40-60%
Captive recapture $730M exceeds total escrow; mitigation via LOC backstop required

correlation_adjustments.methodology: Portfolio correlation theory applied to major risk clusters; correlation coefficients based on financial theory and 2008-2009 crisis precedent

gmwb_x_investment_stress.rationale: Both driven by equity declines + rate shocks; 2008 analog showed high correlation

gmwb_x_captive_recapture.rationale: Both triggered by capital pressure and market stress; regulatory scrutiny increases in parallel

investment_x_credit_defaults.rationale: Rate stress coincides with recession credit stress; macroeconomic drivers correlated

agent_attrition_x_captive.rationale: RBC decline triggers rating downgrade → agent exits; capital pressure drives distribution instability

credit_x_mortgage_losses.rationale: Both driven by recession / CRE downturn; credit cycle correlation

captive_x_global_re.rationale: Both reinsurance issues but different triggers; moderate correlation

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: RBC 188% below 200% CAL; $150M capital injection required via surplus notes (optimal structure)
Vermont captive $850M reserves, $730M parental guarantee (2.6× leverage), 12.5% recapture risk
SEC prospectus deficiency, FINRA violations, E&O exposure $5.4M-$7.15M within $5M SIR
Thompson v. Liberty Life, settlement $30M-$35M target, $8.3M net after E&O coverage
Global Re $850M LOC renewal risk, Swiss Re downgrade risk, total weighted $115.6M
Nebraska DOI 2024 exam, 20 violations, fines $100K-$200K + corrective actions $900K
3 pending VA suitability arbitrations + latent exposure, total $1.66M-$1.89M
Interest rate stress $30.75M weighted, credit defaults $16.4M, mortgage losses $12.5M
Monte Carlo 10K scenarios: median $36M, 95th $127M, 99th $243M; combined with captive = RBC 101%
20-30% attrition risk, $109.9M net after $20M retention bonuses (ROI 450%)
Surplus notes optimal: 100% TAC credit, 5.14% after-tax cost, $39.71M NPV advantage vs equity

quantification_methodology.extraction_source: Pre-extracted from fact-registry.md SECTION 9: QUANTIFIED EXPOSURES BY DOMAIN
quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on: (1) regulatory precedent, (2) industry benchmarks, (3) Monte Carlo simulation (GMWB), (4) scenario analysis (investment stress), (5) actuarial modeling (agent attrition)
quantification_methodology.correlation_methodology: Portfolio correlation theory with correlation matrix (0.45-0.85 coefficients) based on 2008-2009 financial crisis empirical data and risk factor analysis

time_profile_classification.ONE_TIME: Single event, near-term (face value, no adjustment)
time_profile_classification.MULTI_YEAR: Phased program, defined end (DCF at 8% discount rate)
time_profile_classification.PERPETUAL: Recurring annually, no end (NPV at 8% capitalization rate)

critical_conditions_precedent.description: Vermont captive $300M LOC backstop implemented pre-closing OR $150M purchase price reduction
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: Captive recapture 12.5% probability drives RBC to 129% (Regulatory Action Level); deal likely fails without mitigation
critical_conditions_precedent.benefit: Reduces recapture probability from 12.5% to 5-8%; expected value savings $58.1M

critical_conditions_precedent.description: Nebraska DOI final examination report (Q1 2025) does NOT order captive recapture or collateral >$500M
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: If Nebraska orders recapture, RBC falls to 129% even with $150M injection; transaction likely fails state approval

critical_conditions_precedent.description: $400M escrow for 24 months OR $200M-$250M purchase price adjustment
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: Escrow covers 92% of base case exposure ($434M), 52% of bear case ($771M) - industry standard
critical_conditions_precedent.alternative: $225M price adjustment (70% of $335M correlation-adjusted exposure per M&A standard)

critical_conditions_precedent.description: Global Re $850M LOC renewal confirmed through 2030 or alternative reinsurer secured pre-closing
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: Global Re LOC failure = $95.6M weighted exposure; LOC expires 2027, renewal critical

critical_conditions_precedent.description: IUL class action mediation accelerated to Q1-Q2 2025 with settlement target ≤$35M
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: Settlement within $35M reserve avoids incremental surplus charge; mediation scheduled Q2 2025

critical_conditions_precedent.description: $20M agent retention bonus program funded at closing
critical_conditions_precedent.rationale: Reduces attrition from 25% to 10-15%; ROI 450%; net benefit $37.2M over 2 years

post_closing_commitments.commitment: GMWB reinsurance excess of loss ($100M xs $50M) executed within 6 months
post_closing_commitments.benefit: Caps GMWB tail loss at $50M (vs $127M-$243M); reduces combined stress RBC impact

post_closing_commitments.commitment: RBC >180% quarterly monitoring; supplemental capital $50M-$100M if RBC falls <190%
post_closing_commitments.trigger: RBC <190% requires $50M-$100M injection within 60 days; RBC <180% requires $100M-$150M within 90 days

post_closing_commitments.commitment: R&W insurance $150M limit ($15M SIR) for unknown environmental, litigation, tax, regulatory risks

investment_returns.recommendation: PROCEED - Blended IRR 12.35% exceeds 10% PE-backed insurance acquisition hurdle rate
